item.description:
Taoist Yoga-Meditation Mini-Retreat



The White Memorial Conservancy Center, surrounded by miles of walking trails and pine forests, provides a quiet peaceful setting for the SunDo Winter Retreat. You are welcome to join us from 10:30 to 5:30 on Saturday, January 8 to experience SunDo-Taoist practice, homecooked Korean cuisine, and energy healing workshops. The half-day retreat option is for meetup members only.


Saturday's Schedule

10:30 to 11:45 am - Taoist Yoga & Meditation Practice

12 pm to 1 pm - Delicious Korean lunch buffet with vegetarian entree available

1 pm to 2 pm - Winter Forest Walk - frozen ponds, scenic paths, majestic redwoods

2 pm to 4 pm - Introduction to Natural Breathing led by Taoist Master Kim

4:30 to 5:30 - Healing Qi Qong - Eight Pieces of Silk Brocade


Practitioners of all levels are welcome!


The cost is $50 per person the day of the event.
$40 per person if paid early by January 2, 2011.
Pricing and early payment date for meetup members only.

To pay by check, see address on linked Retreat Flyer below.
Please write "mini-retreat" somewhere on your check.



Please stay for dinner if you would like ...

6 pm to 7 pm - Optional: Korean Dinner Buffet (additional $12 cost)


* Meal buffets are all-you-can-eat including a variety of dessert and tea selections!


Directions to White Memorial

Weekend Retreat Flyer


Meetup members can also choose to register for a full day & night or the entire weekend of the retreat. Please email me through the Contact Organizer link if interested in attending for more than half a day.








Regular meditation not only
restores our inner harmony and vital energy,
but provides us with an actual experience of the peace we seek.
item.name: Taoist Yoga-Meditation Mini-Retreat
